ygData.subject: was Slang, now who the hell knows
ygData.messageBody:
<This isn't a case of RPers whining, this is a case of you cheating, whether
you
knew it or not, or acknowledge it or not.>

Not only that, but when they do catch someone exploiting a bug and ban them,
they make sure to announce the names of the guilty parties.
There, Mr.. Say-Ten had been filled in on the possible consequences of his
actions even though it's really none of anyone e;se's business how he
chooses to play, as long as no one else is being hurt by it. If it does
hurt you in some way (takes money from your bank acct, drains exp. from your
character, causes your PC to crash, etc.) please let me know. I, for one,
would be fascinated to know how and/or why the way he, I, or anyone else
plays (aside from direct interaction between characters) could possibly be
of any consequence to you or anyone else.

<Anyone who doesn't have a problem with what you did could only be a cheater
themselves, as far as I could imagine.>

I don't have a problem with it, and am a bit of an RP'r myself, and have
NEVER used a cheat or exploited a bug (that I know of) in this game. As
long as he's not stealing my kills from me (which would be damned hard to do
considering we're on different servers) or my friends why SHOULD I have a
problem with the way he plays?

This whole line of thought smacks a little too much of "Big Brother" to me.

-=B=-
18th
The Rathe
